intro: Boehmeria macrocephala, commonly known as giant flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Its fibrous stems are valued for their strong, durable fibers used in textile production. Boehmeria macrocephala thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
